intro: Pedicularis superba, commonly known as the Queen of the Alps, is a striking alpine plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the genus Pedicularis, which includes over 300 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers, which are often adorned with intricate patterns resembling a beard, hence its common name. It thrives in rocky and high-altitude environments, often growing in alpine meadows and tundra. Pedicularis superba is a perennial herb that produces showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
